div1.p: A letter regarding an issue up for debate at a town council meeting.

opener.salute:
Geo W. Brewer Esq,
Dear Sir

div1.p: Enclosed you an article reflecting on the late Town Council signed "Radical" on calling out the Editer of the "Journal" + demanding the writer he gived a Wm R Stine a clothing man of this placed located here some 12 Moo or Mase he was a candidate for Alderman hones + he + his party were defeated by as he says a combination of the old Coon and the old Nap,

I write + enclosed you the article at the request of J W Brewer Weidlich Hugh McCounll led Mr S Rilchy. JM Hoke, I was the Burgess for ten Yeas previous to March 15" And we are Yet the Acting Council as the late Council has not been sworn in, theer Might have been some things done by former councils during the War, not exactly according to Gunter, but we the present council had nothing to do with it. On first reading the Article we thought we would reply to it + stated we would do so in the paper comeing out (here) on friday but on the Council Meeting together we appointed a Committe to waite on Stine asking him to make a public retraction or we wd institute a suite vs him
if he did not retract, he refused to make any retraction, we now write to advise with you what is best to be done Chereford would like to have your opinion to morrow night that we might make some appology for not answering him as we had stated in the paper of last week we should prefer to punish him at Saw if we can sustain action vs him for libel, or a private conversation wd might ventilate the subject more fully We desire your to read the article + have your opinion as to what we could do with him in a prosecution
